pageProps.contentHtml:
entire functions

Let f ⁣:C→C\func{f}{\C}{\C}f:C→C be an entire function. Show that

∣f(z)∣≤Cea∣z∣,z∈C,\abs{f\p{z}} \leq Ce^{a\abs{z}},\quad z\in \C,∣f(z)∣≤Cea∣z∣,z∈C,

for some constants CCC and aaa if and only if we have

∣f(n)(0)∣≤Mn+1,n=0,1,…,\abs{f^{\p{n}}\p{0}} \leq M^{n+1},\quad n = 0, 1, \ldots,∣∣​f(n)(0)∣∣​≤Mn+1,n=0,1,…,

for some constant MMM.
Solution.

"  ⟹  \implies⟹"

By the Cauchy estimates, we get for any n>0n > 0n>0 that

∣f(n)(0)∣≤n!2π∫∂B(0,n)∣f(ζ)∣∣ζ∣n+1 d∣ζ∣≤n!nnCean≤Aean\begin{aligned} \abs{f^{\p{n}}\p{0}} &\leq \frac{n!}{2\pi} \int_{\partial B\p{0,n}} \frac{\abs{f\p{\zeta}}}{\abs{\zeta}^{n+1}} \,\diff\abs{\zeta} \\ &\leq \frac{n!}{n^n} Ce^{an} \\ &\leq Ae^{an} \end{aligned}∣∣​f(n)(0)∣∣​​≤2πn!​∫∂B(0,n)​∣ζ∣n+1∣f(ζ)∣​d∣ζ∣≤nnn!​Cean≤Aean​

by Stirling's approximation. Increasing AAA if necessary, we may assume that A>1A > 1A>1 so that ∣f(n)(0)∣≤(Aea)n+1\abs{f^{\p{n}}\p{0}} \leq \p{Ae^a}^{n+1}∣∣​f(n)(0)∣∣​≤(Aea)n+1 for all n≥0n \geq 0n≥0.

"  ⟸  \impliedby⟸"

Writing f(z)=∑n=0∞anznf\p{z} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nz^nf(z)=∑n=0∞​an​zn, we see

∣an∣=∣f(n)(0)n!∣≤Mn+1n!.\abs{a_n} = \abs{\frac{f^{\p{n}}\p{0}}{n!}} \leq \frac{M^{n+1}}{n!}.∣an​∣=∣∣​n!f(n)(0)​∣∣​≤n!Mn+1​.

Thus,

∣f(z)∣≤∑n=0∞Mn+1n!∣z∣n=MeM∣z∣.\abs{f\p{z}} \leq \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{M^{n+1}}{n!}\abs{z}^n = Me^{M\abs{z}}.∣f(z)∣≤n=0∑∞​n!Mn+1​∣z∣n=MeM∣z∣.
